test_cases.Title: Verify Project Documentation Metadata Integrity

Steps.Step Description: Access the project documentation for 'ZENIT -- GESTIONE FIDO CENTRALIZZATO -- FASE 1'.
Steps.Expected Result: The documentation is accessible and displays the project title and phase.

Steps.Step Description: Locate the section containing the emission cycle, acronyms, dates, and signatures.
Steps.Expected Result: The section is present and contains fields for emission cycle, acronyms, date, and signature.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the documentation lists the author, verifier(s), and approver with corresponding dates.
Steps.Expected Result: The documentation displays 'Redatto da', 'Verificato da', and 'Approvato da' with correct names and dates.

Steps.Step Description: Check the revision history table for completeness and chronological order.
Steps.Expected Result: The revision history table lists all revisions with numbers, descriptions, and dates in chronological order.

test_cases.Preconditions: The latest version of the project documentation is available for review.
test_cases.Dataset: Project documentation file (PDF, DOCX, or similar)
test_cases.Expected Result: The project documentation contains all required metadata fields, revision history, and is up-to-date and accurate.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers only documentation metadata, not functional requirements.

test_cases.Title: Verify Revision History Update on Documentation Change

Steps.Step Description: Open the project documentation and review the latest revision entry in the revision history table.
Steps.Expected Result: The latest revision entry is present with a unique revision number, description, and date.

Steps.Step Description: Simulate a documentation update (e.g., add a new requirement or modify an existing one).
Steps.Expected Result: A change is made to the documentation.

Steps.Step Description: Save the updated documentation and add a new entry to the revision history table with the new revision number, description of the change, and current date.
Steps.Expected Result: A new revision entry is added to the revision history table.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the revision history table now includes the new entry in the correct chronological order.
Steps.Expected Result: The new revision entry appears at the top or in the correct order, and all previous entries remain unchanged.

test_cases.Preconditions: User has edit access to the documentation and knowledge of the revision process.
test_cases.Dataset: Editable project documentation file
test_cases.Expected Result: Each documentation update is reflected in the revision history table with accurate details and correct ordering.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Focuses on revision history update, not on content validation.

test_cases.Title: Verify User Signature and Approval Workflow in Documentation

Steps.Step Description: Open the project documentation and navigate to the signature section.
Steps.Expected Result: The signature section is present and clearly labeled.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the documentation lists the names and roles of the author, verifier(s), and approver.
Steps.Expected Result: Names and roles for 'Redatto da', 'Verificato da', and 'Approvato da' are present.

Steps.Step Description: Check that each listed person has a corresponding date next to their name.
Steps.Expected Result: Each name is associated with a date indicating when the action was performed.

Steps.Step Description: Ensure that the approval workflow follows the correct sequence: authoring, verification, then approval.
Steps.Expected Result: The workflow sequence is correct and no steps are missing or out of order.

test_cases.Preconditions: The documentation has completed the authoring, verification, and approval process.
test_cases.Dataset: Project documentation with completed signature section
test_cases.Expected Result: The documentation accurately reflects the signature and approval workflow with correct names, roles, and dates.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Does not cover digital signature validation, only presence and correctness of data.

test_cases.Title: Verify Data Collection from SAP System

Steps.Step Description: Login to the system with valid credentials and appropriate permissions.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in and lands on the dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the data collection module.
Steps.Expected Result: Data collection module is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Initiate data collection from SAP by selecting the SAP data source and starting the process.
Steps.Expected Result: System starts the data collection process from SAP.

Steps.Step Description: Wait for the process to complete and check the status message.
Steps.Expected Result: System displays a success message indicating data collection from SAP is complete.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the collected SAP data is visible and correctly populated in the system.
Steps.Expected Result: SAP data is present, accurate, and matches the expected format.

test_cases.Preconditions: User has valid credentials and access rights. SAP system is available and contains test data.
test_cases.Dataset: Test SAP credentials and sample SAP data records.
test_cases.Expected Result: System successfully collects and displays SAP data without errors.

test_cases.Title: Verify Dashboard Access for Full Access Profile

Steps.Step Description: Login to the system using a user account with 'Full Access' profile.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and redirected to the dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that all dashboard features (data visualization, reports, management tools) are accessible.
Steps.Expected Result: All dashboard features are visible and accessible to the user.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to access restricted or admin-only features.
Steps.Expected Result: User can access all features without restriction.

test_cases.Preconditions: User account with 'Full Access' profile exists.
test_cases.Dataset: Full Access user credentials.
test_cases.Expected Result: User with 'Full Access' profile can access all dashboard features.

test_cases.Title: Verify Data Archiving Functionality

test_cases.Title: Verify Login and Logout Functionality

test_cases.Expected Result: System gracefully handles data source unavailability and informs the user.

test_cases.Title: Verify Automated Actions Triggered by Parameter Detection

test_cases.Dataset: Test POS terminals with configurable parameters.
test_cases.Expected Result: Dashboard automatically triggers the correct management action when specified parameters are detected, and logs the event appropriately.

test_cases.Title: Verify Data Analysis and Alert/Proposal Generation in Predictive Phase

test_cases.Title: Verify Dashboard Handles Missing or Incomplete Data Gracefully

test_cases.Title: Fido Assignment at PoS Activation Based on Cerved Rating and Terminal Type

Steps.Step Description: Initiate activation process for a new PoS with a specific terminal type (e.g., Galileo, Microlot, Leonardo, Best, Self, Selfy, Aio, Wave).
Steps.Expected Result: Activation process starts and terminal type is recorded.

Steps.Step Description: Obtain Cerved rating for the PoS (e.g., N/D, 20, 40, 60, 80, 100).
Steps.Expected Result: Cerved rating is available and associated with the PoS.

Steps.Step Description: Refer to the Credit Policy table to determine the initial fido amount based on the Cerved rating and terminal type.
Steps.Expected Result: Correct initial fido amount is identified as per policy.

Steps.Step Description: Assign the calculated fido to the PoS during activation.
Steps.Expected Result: PoS is activated with the correct fido amount assigned.

test_cases.Preconditions: PoS is not yet activated. Cerved rating is available. Terminal type is known. Credit Policy table is accessible.
test_cases.Dataset: Sample PoS data, Cerved ratings (N/D, 20, 40, 60, 80, 100), terminal types (Galileo, Microlot, Leonardo, Best, Self, Selfy, Aio, Wave).
test_cases.Expected Result: PoS is activated with the correct fido assigned according to Cerved rating and terminal type as per Credit Policy.

test_cases.Title: Fido Extension Request and Approval Workflow (SIMP and GEO)

Steps.Step Description: Simulate fido exhaustion or near-exhaustion for a PoS (SIMP or GEO).
Steps.Expected Result: System detects fido is exhausted or near exhaustion.

Steps.Step Description: Initiate a fido extension request from one of the allowed sources (FV, PoS, Gestione Crediti, or automatic alert for SIMP).
Steps.Expected Result: Extension request is received by Gestione Crediti.

Steps.Step Description: For SIMP: Check if extension parameters (red-list, +50%, +1k, KO) are applied. For GEO: Check if scoring, payments, and red-list are considered.
Steps.Expected Result: Extension amount is calculated according to rules.

Steps.Step Description: Route approval to the correct authority based on extension amount (Credit Coordinator Albania, CM, Director, CFO).
Steps.Expected Result: Approval is routed and processed as per policy.

Steps.Step Description: If approved, notify the relevant team (SIMP: Customer Care B2B; GEO: Back Office Albania) and update the fido.
Steps.Expected Result: Fido is extended and teams are notified.

test_cases.Preconditions: PoS is active with fido near exhaustion. Extension rules and approval hierarchy are defined. Red-list and scoring data are available.
test_cases.Dataset: PoS with low fido, red-list status, scoring data, extension request data.
test_cases.Expected Result: Fido extension is processed according to business rules, with correct approval and notification.

test_cases.Title: Fido Reduction Due to Risk or Insolvency (SIMP and GEO)

Steps.Step Description: Identify a PoS with risk factors (e.g., client at risk, insolvency, decreasing scoring, guarantee reset).
Steps.Expected Result: PoS is flagged for fido reduction.

Steps.Step Description: Gestione Crediti decides to reduce the fido and communicates the reduction to the relevant team (SIMP: Customer Care B2B; GEO: Back Office Albania).
Steps.Expected Result: Reduction request is received by the appropriate team.

Steps.Step Description: For SIMP: Set fido to 100 symbolic (not zero). For GEO: Set fido to zero if required.
Steps.Expected Result: Fido is reduced as per system rules (100 for SIMP, zero for GEO).

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the PoS cannot operate beyond the new fido limit.
Steps.Expected Result: PoS operations are restricted according to the reduced fido.

test_cases.Preconditions: PoS is active. Risk factors are present. Teams are available to process reduction.
test_cases.Dataset: PoS flagged for risk, insolvency, or scoring drop.
test_cases.Expected Result: Fido is reduced according to policy and PoS operations are limited accordingly.

test_cases.Title: Fido Zeroing for Legal/Collection Cases (SIMP and GEO)

Steps.Step Description: Identify a PoS in legal/collection/diffida status.
Steps.Expected Result: PoS is flagged for fido zeroing.

Steps.Step Description: Gestione Crediti initiates fido zeroing and notifies the relevant team (SIMP: Customer Care B2B; GEO: Back Office Albania).
Steps.Expected Result: Zeroing request is received by the appropriate team.

Steps.Step Description: For SIMP: Set fido to 100 symbolic. For GEO: Set fido to zero.
Steps.Expected Result: Fido is set to 100 (SIMP) or zero (GEO) as per policy.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the PoS cannot operate beyond the new fido limit.
Steps.Expected Result: PoS operations are restricted according to the zeroed fido.

test_cases.Preconditions: PoS is in legal/collection/diffida status. Teams are available to process zeroing.
test_cases.Dataset: PoS in legal/collection/diffida status.
test_cases.Expected Result: Fido is zeroed (or set to 100 for SIMP) and PoS operations are limited accordingly.

test_cases.Title: Fido Restoration After Collection/Legal Resolution (SIMP and GEO)

Steps.Step Description: Identify a PoS previously zeroed due to collection/legal status, now with resolved status (e.g., recovered insolvency, positive closure).
Steps.Expected Result: PoS is eligible for fido restoration.

Steps.Step Description: Gestione Crediti reviews the PoS scoring and/or receives feedback from CM.
Steps.Expected Result: Restoration eligibility and amount are determined.

Steps.Step Description: Gestione Crediti notifies the relevant team (SIMP: Customer Care B2B; GEO: Back Office Albania) to restore fido.
Steps.Expected Result: Restoration request is received by the appropriate team.

Steps.Step Description: Restore fido to the appropriate amount based on scoring or CM feedback.
Steps.Expected Result: Fido is restored and PoS can operate within the new limit.

test_cases.Preconditions: PoS previously zeroed and now eligible for restoration. Scoring and feedback data available.
test_cases.Dataset: PoS with resolved collection/legal status, scoring data, CM feedback.
test_cases.Expected Result: Fido is restored according to policy and PoS operations resume within the new limit.

test_cases.Title: Daily and Weekly Fido Recharge Logic for SIMP and GEO

Steps.Step Description: For a SIMP-managed PoS, set up both daily and weekly fido types with initial values.
Steps.Expected Result: PoS is configured with both daily and weekly fido.

Steps.Step Description: Simulate daily operations and verify that the daily fido is recharged every day to the initial value.
Steps.Expected Result: Daily fido is reset to the initial value each day.

Steps.Step Description: Simulate weekly operations and verify that the weekly fido is recharged every 7 days based on the consumption of the 7th previous day (rolling logic).
Steps.Expected Result: Weekly fido is recharged according to rolling logic.

Steps.Step Description: For GEO-managed PoS, verify that only weekly fido is present and it is recharged every Monday to the base value set at activation.
Steps.Expected Result: Weekly fido is reset to the base value every Monday.

test_cases.Preconditions: PoS is active and configured for SIMP or GEO. Initial fido values are set.
test_cases.Dataset: PoS with SIMP and GEO configurations, initial fido values, simulated daily/weekly operations.
test_cases.Expected Result: Fido is recharged daily/weekly as per system logic for SIMP and GEO.

test_cases.Title: Fido Calculation on 'Cassa' for SIMP and on 'Raccolta' for VR on TG BEST and GEO

Steps.Step Description: For a SIMP-managed PoS, perform a series of plays and record winnings to calculate 'cassa' (plays minus winnings).
Steps.Expected Result: 'Cassa' value is calculated correctly.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that fido is managed based on 'cassa' for all products except VR on TG BEST.
Steps.Expected Result: Fido is updated according to 'cassa' for applicable products.

Steps.Step Description: For VR on TG BEST and GEO, perform plays and verify that fido is managed based on 'raccolta' only (total plays, not considering winnings).
Steps.Expected Result: Fido is updated according to 'raccolta' for VR on TG BEST and GEO.

test_cases.Preconditions: PoS is active with SIMP or GEO management. Plays and winnings data are available.
test_cases.Dataset: PoS with SIMP and GEO, plays and winnings data, VR on TG BEST.
test_cases.Expected Result: Fido is calculated and updated according to 'cassa' or 'raccolta' as per product and platform rules.

test_cases.Title: No Fido Management for AWP (IAG and NO IAG)

Steps.Step Description: Identify a PoS with AWP IAG and NO IAG terminals (with both 'chiavi gestore' and 'chiavi esercente').
Steps.Expected Result: PoS is configured with AWP terminals.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to set or modify fido for AWP IAG and NO IAG terminals.
Steps.Expected Result: System does not allow fido management for these terminals.

Steps.Step Description: Perform collection operations on AWP terminals and verify there are no fido limits applied.
Steps.Expected Result: No fido limit is enforced; collection is unlimited.

test_cases.Dataset: PoS with AWP IAG and NO IAG terminals.
test_cases.Expected Result: No fido management is possible or enforced for AWP terminals, regardless of key type.

test_cases.Title: Association of Fido to PoS during Activation for GNTN and ONLINE Products

Steps.Step Description: Initiate PoS activation process for a new terminal (Galileo, Microlot, or Leonardo) with GNTN product.
Steps.Expected Result: System prompts for fido association based on product type.

Steps.Step Description: Complete activation process and confirm fido association.
Steps.Expected Result: Fido is associated to the PoS and visible in the system.

Steps.Step Description: Repeat activation for ONLINE product with a different terminal type.
Steps.Expected Result: Fido is associated to the PoS for ONLINE product as well.

test_cases.Dataset: Sample PoS IDs, product types (GNTN, ONLINE), terminal types.
test_cases.Expected Result: Fido is correctly associated to the PoS during activation for both GNTN and ONLINE products.

test_cases.Title: Weekly Fido Recharge on GEO Management System

Steps.Step Description: Verify current fido balance for a PoS on Sunday evening.
Steps.Expected Result: Fido balance reflects the current week's usage.

Steps.Step Description: Wait until Monday (system scheduled recharge time).
Steps.Expected Result: System triggers weekly fido recharge process.

Steps.Step Description: Check fido balance after recharge on Monday.
Steps.Expected Result: Fido balance is reset to the base value as configured.

test_cases.Dataset: PoS with known fido base value.
test_cases.Expected Result: Fido is recharged to the base value every Monday as per configuration.

test_cases.Title: Default Fido Assignment for Precaricato Generalist PoS

Steps.Step Description: Initiate activation of a new PoS as Generalista Precaricato (awaiting SDD alignment).
Steps.Expected Result: System recognizes PoS as Precaricato and skips credit management authorization.

Steps.Step Description: Complete activation process.
Steps.Expected Result: PoS is activated with a default fido of 300 .

Steps.Step Description: Verify fido value assigned to the PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: Fido value is exactly 300 .

test_cases.Dataset: PoS to be activated as Precaricato.
test_cases.Expected Result: Precaricato PoS is assigned a default fido of 300  without credit management authorization.

test_cases.Title: Fido Assignment Based on Cerved Rating for Standard Generalist PoS

Steps.Step Description: Initiate activation of a new PoS as Generalista Standard with a specific Cerved rating (e.g., 80).
Steps.Expected Result: System retrieves Cerved rating and determines fido value according to policy table.

Steps.Step Description: Complete activation process.
Steps.Expected Result: PoS is activated with fido corresponding to the Cerved rating.

Steps.Step Description: Verify assigned fido value matches policy for the given rating.
Steps.Expected Result: Fido value is as per Credit Policy table for rating 80.

test_cases.Title: Fido Transfer and Reset During PoS Voltura (Change of Ownership)

Steps.Step Description: Identify an existing PoS with active fido and initiate voltura process (change of ownership/ID).
Steps.Expected Result: System prepares to transfer PoS to new ID.

Steps.Step Description: Complete voltura process.
Steps.Expected Result: Fido on old PoS ID is reset to zero.

Steps.Step Description: Verify fido is associated with new PoS ID as per activation rules.
Steps.Expected Result: New PoS ID has fido assigned according to activation policy.

test_cases.Preconditions: PoS eligible for voltura. Both old and new IDs available.
test_cases.Dataset: PoS with existing fido, new PoS ID for transfer.
test_cases.Expected Result: Fido is reset on old ID and correctly associated with new ID during voltura.

test_cases.Title: Modification of Fido Based on Rating, Volume, Payment Regularity, Guarantees, or FV Report

Steps.Step Description: Request fido modification due to change in Cerved rating for a PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: System processes rating change and recalculates fido as per policy.

Steps.Step Description: Request fido modification due to change in gaming volume.
Steps.Expected Result: System evaluates new volume and updates fido accordingly.

Steps.Step Description: Request fido modification due to payment irregularities (number of unpaid items).
Steps.Expected Result: System reviews payment history and adjusts fido if necessary.

Steps.Step Description: Request fido modification due to new guarantees provided.
Steps.Expected Result: System considers guarantees and updates fido as per policy.

Steps.Step Description: Request fido modification due to FV report.
Steps.Expected Result: System processes FV report and updates fido if required.

test_cases.Preconditions: PoS with modifiable fido. Access to all modification triggers.
test_cases.Dataset: PoS with various triggers for fido modification.
test_cases.Expected Result: Fido is modified correctly based on the specified parameter changes.

test_cases.Title: Temporary Fido Increase After 18:00 or During Weekend with Red List Check

Steps.Step Description: Request a fido increase for a PoS after 18:00 or during the weekend.
Steps.Expected Result: System checks if the PoS is present in the Red List.

Steps.Step Description: If PoS is not in Red List, approve temporary fido increase.
Steps.Expected Result: Temporary fido increase is applied to the PoS.

Steps.Step Description: If PoS is in Red List, deny temporary fido increase.
Steps.Expected Result: System denies the temporary fido increase request.

test_cases.Functionality: Temporary fido increase with Red List check
test_cases.Dataset: PoS in and out of Red List, time of request (after 18:00, weekend).

test_cases.Title: Fido Reset for ONLINE PoS Blocked Due to Insoluti and Restoration After Payment

Steps.Expected Result: System blocks the PoS and resets fido to zero.

Steps.Step Description: Simulate payment of the outstanding amount (ripristino).
Steps.Expected Result: System restores fido to the PoS as per previous configuration.

test_cases.Title: Fido Assignment on PoS Activation Based on Product and Rating

test_cases.Title: Automatic Fido Extension at 90% Consumption for SIMP Products

Steps.Step Description: Verify if the system automatically extends the fido by 50% (e.g., new fido is 1500 EUR).

test_cases.Title: Automated Data Collection from CERVED System (Scoring and Commercial Info)

Steps.Step Description: Initiate automated data collection from the CERVED system.
Steps.Expected Result: System connects to CERVED system.

Steps.Step Description: Retrieve scoring and commercial information for a specified entity.
Steps.Expected Result: Scoring and commercial info are retrieved for the entity.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the data is aggregated and displayed in the dashboard, and check for risk alerts if the score worsens.
Steps.Expected Result: Dashboard displays scoring and commercial info; alert is triggered if risk has worsened.

test_cases.Preconditions: CERVED system is online; entity with scoring data exists; integration endpoints are configured.
test_cases.Functionality: Automated data collection and risk alert from CERVED system.
test_cases.Dataset: Sample entities with scoring and commercial info in CERVED.
test_cases.Expected Result: Scoring and commercial info are collected and displayed; risk alert is triggered if applicable.

test_cases.Title: Manual Data Entry and Aggregation from DWH (GNTN Average and Decile)

Steps.Step Description: Trigger the data collection process for DWH.
Steps.Expected Result: System connects to DWH.

Steps.Step Description: Retrieve GNTN average data for the relevant period.
Steps.Expected Result: GNTN average is retrieved.

Steps.Step Description: Manually enter the decile value as provided by the designated user.
Steps.Expected Result: Decile value is entered and accepted by the system.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that both GNTN average and decile are aggregated and displayed in the dashboard.
Steps.Expected Result: Dashboard displays GNTN average and decile for the period.

test_cases.Preconditions: DWH system is online; user with permission to enter decile value is available.
test_cases.Functionality: Automated and manual data collection from DWH, including manual decile entry.
test_cases.Dataset: Sample GNTN data in DWH; decile value from user.
test_cases.Expected Result: GNTN average is collected and decile is manually entered, both displayed in the dashboard.

test_cases.Title: Automated Data Collection from SAP (Financial and Guarantee Data)

Steps.Step Description: Initiate automated data collection from SAP.
Steps.Expected Result: System connects to SAP.

Steps.Step Description: Retrieve financial data: outstanding payments, average BC, ageing, payments, expired, guarantees, etc., for a POS.
Steps.Expected Result: All required financial and guarantee data are retrieved for the POS.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that guarantee deposit amount and timing to reach target are displayed.
Steps.Expected Result: Dashboard displays guarantee deposit and timing information.

Steps.Step Description: Check that the expiry date for sureties is indicated.
Steps.Expected Result: Expiry date for sureties is displayed in the dashboard.

test_cases.Preconditions: SAP system is online; POS with financial and guarantee data exists; integration endpoints are configured.
test_cases.Functionality: Automated data collection and display of financial and guarantee data from SAP.
test_cases.Dataset: Sample POS with financial and guarantee data in SAP.
test_cases.Expected Result: Financial and guarantee data are collected and displayed, including guarantee deposit, timing, and surety expiry.

test_cases.Title: Automated Data Collection from SIMP System (Credit Utilization and Alerts)

Steps.Step Description: Initiate automated data collection from SIMP system.
Steps.Expected Result: System connects to SIMP.

Steps.Step Description: Retrieve all credit entries (amount, % utilization, collection, number of extensions, winnings paid/unpaid) for the year for a POS.
Steps.Expected Result: All required credit data are retrieved for the POS.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the system analyzes historical collection and utilization trends.
Steps.Expected Result: Historical trends are analyzed and displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Simulate approaching a specific utilization threshold to trigger an alert.
Steps.Expected Result: System sends a specific alert when the threshold is approached.

test_cases.Preconditions: SIMP system is online; POS with credit data exists; alert thresholds are configured.
test_cases.Functionality: Automated data collection, trend analysis, and alerting from SIMP system.
test_cases.Dataset: Sample POS with credit data in SIMP; configured alert threshold.
test_cases.Expected Result: Credit data are collected, trends analyzed, and alert is triggered when utilization threshold is approached.

test_cases.Title: Automated Data Collection from ARXIVAR (NEXT) System (Contract Links)

Steps.Step Description: Initiate automated data collection from ARXIVAR (NEXT) system.
Steps.Expected Result: System connects to ARXIVAR (NEXT).

Steps.Step Description: Retrieve contract links for a specified POS or entity.
Steps.Expected Result: Contract links are retrieved for the POS/entity.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the contract links are displayed in the dashboard and accessible.
Steps.Expected Result: Dashboard displays contract links, and links are accessible.

test_cases.Preconditions: ARXIVAR (NEXT) system is online; POS/entity with contracts exists; integration endpoints are configured.
test_cases.Functionality: Automated data collection and display of contract links from ARXIVAR (NEXT).
test_cases.Dataset: Sample POS/entity with contracts in ARXIVAR (NEXT).
test_cases.Expected Result: Contract links are collected and displayed in the dashboard, and are accessible.

test_cases.Title: Negative Test: Data Collection Fails Due to System Unavailability

Steps.Step Description: Simulate unavailability of a connected system (e.g., shut down MDM).
Steps.Expected Result: System cannot connect to the unavailable system.

Steps.Step Description: Trigger the automated data collection process for the unavailable system.
Steps.Expected Result: System logs an error and displays a notification of the failure.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the dashboard does not display outdated or partial data from the unavailable system.
Steps.Expected Result: Dashboard does not show stale or incomplete data; error is clearly indicated.

test_cases.Preconditions: At least one connected system is intentionally made unavailable; integration endpoints are configured.
test_cases.Functionality: Error handling for failed data collection due to system unavailability.
test_cases.Dataset: Unavailable system (e.g., MDM offline).
test_cases.Expected Result: System handles the error gracefully, logs it, notifies the user, and prevents display of outdated/partial data.

test_cases.Title: Negative Test: Data Collection with Invalid or Corrupted Data

Steps.Step Description: Configure a connected system (e.g., INVENTORY) to return invalid or corrupted data during collection.
Steps.Expected Result: System receives invalid/corrupted data from the source.

Steps.Step Description: Trigger the automated data collection process for the affected system.
Steps.Expected Result: System detects the invalid/corrupted data.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the system logs the error, notifies the user, and does not aggregate or display the invalid data.
Steps.Expected Result: Error is logged, user is notified, and invalid data is not shown in the dashboard.

test_cases.Preconditions: Connected system is configured to return invalid/corrupted data; integration endpoints are configured.
test_cases.Functionality: Validation and error handling for invalid/corrupted data during collection.
test_cases.Dataset: Invalid/corrupted data from source system (e.g., INVENTORY).
test_cases.Expected Result: System detects and handles invalid/corrupted data, logs the error, notifies the user, and prevents display of such data.

test_cases.Title: Verify Dashboard Data Aggregation and Display for Individual PoS

Steps.Step Description: Login to the application with valid credentials.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in and redirected to the dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the dashboard section.
Steps.Expected Result: Dashboard is displayed with data for all PoS as per requirement 3.1.

Steps.Step Description: Select a specific PoS from the dashboard view.
Steps.Expected Result: Dashboard updates to show detailed data for the selected PoS.

test_cases.Preconditions: User has valid credentials. At least one PoS with data exists in the system.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user credentials; at least one PoS with associated data.
test_cases.Expected Result: Dashboard displays accurate and complete data for the selected PoS as per requirement 3.1.

test_cases.Title: Verify Dashboard Data Aggregation and Filtering by Nature

Steps.Step Description: Login to the application with valid credentials.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in and redirected to the dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the dashboard section.
Steps.Expected Result: Dashboard is displayed with data for all PoS.

Steps.Step Description: Apply a filter to aggregate PoS data by a specific nature (e.g., region, type).
Steps.Expected Result: Dashboard updates to show aggregated data according to the selected nature.

test_cases.Preconditions: User has valid credentials. Multiple PoS with different natures exist in the system.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user credentials; PoS with various natures (e.g., region, type).
test_cases.Expected Result: Dashboard displays aggregated data correctly according to the selected nature.

test_cases.Title: Verify Search Functionality within Dashboard

Steps.Step Description: Login to the application with valid credentials.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in and redirected to the dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the dashboard section.
Steps.Expected Result: Dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Enter a valid PoS identifier or name in the search bar and initiate the search.
Steps.Expected Result: Dashboard displays results matching the search criteria.

test_cases.Preconditions: User has valid credentials. At least one PoS exists in the system.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user credentials; existing PoS identifiers/names.
test_cases.Expected Result: Dashboard returns accurate search results based on the entered criteria.

test_cases.Title: Verify PoS Management from Dashboard

Steps.Step Description: Login to the application with valid credentials.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in and redirected to the dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the dashboard section.
Steps.Expected Result: Dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Select a PoS and choose the management option (e.g., edit, disable, or delete).
Steps.Expected Result: PoS management options are available and functional.

Steps.Step Description: Perform a management action (e.g., edit PoS details).
Steps.Expected Result: PoS details are updated and reflected in the dashboard.

test_cases.Preconditions: User has valid credentials. At least one PoS exists in the system.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user credentials; PoS with editable details.
test_cases.Expected Result: PoS management actions (edit, disable, delete) are executed successfully and changes are reflected in the dashboard.

test_cases.Title: Verify Report Request Functionality from Dashboard

Steps.Step Description: Login to the application with valid credentials.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in and redirected to the dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the dashboard section.
Steps.Expected Result: Dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Select the option to request a report for a specific PoS or aggregated data.
Steps.Expected Result: Report request dialog or form is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Submit the report request with valid parameters.
Steps.Expected Result: System processes the request and confirms report generation.

test_cases.Preconditions: User has valid credentials. At least one PoS exists in the system.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user credentials; PoS with reportable data.
test_cases.Expected Result: Report request is processed and confirmation is provided to the user.

test_cases.Title: Verify Alert Reception in Dashboard

Steps.Step Description: Login to the application with valid credentials.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in and redirected to the dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the dashboard section.
Steps.Expected Result: Dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Trigger a condition that should generate an alert (e.g., PoS offline, threshold exceeded).
Steps.Expected Result: Dashboard displays the corresponding alert notification.

test_cases.Preconditions: User has valid credentials. System is configured to generate alerts for specific conditions.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user credentials; PoS with alert-triggering conditions.
test_cases.Expected Result: Dashboard displays alerts in real-time or near real-time when conditions are met.

test_cases.Title: Verify Dashboard Search with Invalid Criteria

Steps.Step Description: Login to the application with valid credentials.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in and redirected to the dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the dashboard section.
Steps.Expected Result: Dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Enter an invalid or non-existent PoS identifier in the search bar and initiate the search.
Steps.Expected Result: Dashboard displays a message indicating no results found.

test_cases.Preconditions: User has valid credentials. No PoS matches the invalid search criteria.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user credentials; invalid/non-existent PoS identifier.
test_cases.Expected Result: Dashboard handles invalid search gracefully and informs the user that no results were found.

test_cases.Title: Verify Dashboard Accessibility and Responsiveness

Steps.Step Description: Login to the application with valid credentials on different devices (desktop, tablet, mobile).
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in and redirected to the dashboard on each device.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the dashboard section on each device.
Steps.Expected Result: Dashboard is displayed correctly and is responsive to the device screen size.

test_cases.Preconditions: User has valid credentials. Application is accessible from multiple device types.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user credentials; access to desktop, tablet, and mobile devices.
test_cases.Expected Result: Dashboard is accessible and displays correctly on all supported devices.

test_cases.Title: Verify daily and weekly credit usage history is stored correctly

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the application as a user with active credit usage.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in and dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Perform a transaction that utilizes part of the daily credit limit.
Steps.Expected Result: Transaction is completed and daily credit usage is updated.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Credit Usage History' section of the application.
Steps.Expected Result: 'Credit Usage History' section is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Review the displayed daily and weekly credit usage records.
Steps.Expected Result: The transaction performed in Step 2 is present in the daily and weekly usage history with correct date, amount, and remaining limit.

test_cases.Preconditions: User account exists with credit feature enabled. At least one transaction has been performed today and this week.
test_cases.Functionality: Historical data storage for daily and weekly credit usage
test_cases.Dataset: User credentials, transaction details (amount, date, type)
test_cases.Expected Result: The system accurately stores and displays historical daily and weekly credit usage data for the user.

test_cases.Title: Verify historical data retention after multiple transactions over several weeks

Steps.Step Description: Log in as a user with credit usage history spanning several weeks.
Steps.Expected Result: User is logged in and dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Credit Usage History' section.
Steps.Expected Result: 'Credit Usage History' section is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Select a previous week from the available history.
Steps.Expected Result: Historical data for the selected week is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that all transactions for the selected week are present and accurate.
Steps.Expected Result: All transactions for the selected week are listed with correct details (date, amount, type, remaining limit).

test_cases.Preconditions: User account with at least 3 weeks of credit usage history.
test_cases.Dataset: User credentials with multi-week transaction history
test_cases.Expected Result: The system retains and accurately displays historical credit usage data for multiple weeks.

test_cases.Title: Verify system behavior when no historical credit usage data is present

Steps.Step Description: Log in as a new user with no credit usage history.
Steps.Expected Result: User is logged in and dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Credit Usage History' section.
Steps.Expected Result: 'Credit Usage History' section is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the displayed information for historical credit usage.
Steps.Expected Result: A message indicating 'No historical data available' or similar is displayed. No erroneous or placeholder data is shown.

test_cases.Preconditions: User account exists with no credit usage history.
test_cases.Dataset: New user credentials
test_cases.Expected Result: The system gracefully handles the absence of historical data and informs the user appropriately.

test_cases.Title: Verify historical data integrity after system update or migration

Steps.Step Description: Log in as a user with existing historical credit usage data before the system update/migration.
Steps.Expected Result: User is logged in and dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Credit Usage History' section and record current data.
Steps.Expected Result: Historical data is displayed and recorded for comparison.

Steps.Step Description: Simulate or perform a system update or data migration.
Steps.Expected Result: System update/migration completes successfully.

Steps.Step Description: Log in again as the same user after the update/migration.
Steps.Expected Result: User is logged in and dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Credit Usage History' section and compare data with the record from Step 2.
Steps.Expected Result: All historical data remains intact and unchanged after the update/migration.

test_cases.Preconditions: User account with historical data exists. System update/migration is planned or can be simulated in test environment.
test_cases.Functionality: Historical data integrity after system changes
test_cases.Dataset: User credentials, pre-update historical data snapshot
test_cases.Expected Result: Historical credit usage data is preserved and unaltered after system updates or migrations.

test_cases.Title: Verify access control for historical credit usage data

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to access the 'Credit Usage History' section as an unauthorized user (e.g., without proper permissions).
Steps.Expected Result: Access is denied and an appropriate error message is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Log in as an authorized user and access the 'Credit Usage History' section.
Steps.Expected Result: Authorized user can access and view historical credit usage data.

test_cases.Preconditions: Both authorized and unauthorized user accounts exist.
test_cases.Dataset: Authorized and unauthorized user credentials
test_cases.Expected Result: Only authorized users can access historical credit usage data; unauthorized users are denied access.

test_cases.Title: Verify Data Collection from SAP Source

Steps.Step Description: Access the data collection module as an authorized user.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and data collection module is accessible.

Steps.Step Description: Initiate data collection from the SAP source system.
Steps.Expected Result: System initiates connection to SAP and starts data retrieval.

Steps.Step Description: Monitor the data collection process for completion.
Steps.Expected Result: Data is successfully collected from SAP without errors.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the collected data is stored in the target repository.
Steps.Expected Result: All expected SAP data records are present and accurate in the repository.

test_cases.Preconditions: User has valid credentials and access rights. SAP source system is available and contains test data.
test_cases.Dataset: Test SAP data records available in source system.
test_cases.Expected Result: Data from SAP is collected and stored accurately in the target repository without errors.

test_cases.Title: Verify Dashboard Login with Full Access Profile

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the dashboard login page.
Steps.Expected Result: Login page is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Enter valid credentials for a user with Full Access profile.
Steps.Expected Result: Credentials are accepted.

Steps.Step Description: Click the login button.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and redirected to the dashboard main page with Full Access permissions.

test_cases.Preconditions: Full Access user account exists and is active.
test_cases.Dataset: Full Access user credentials.
test_cases.Expected Result: User with Full Access profile can successfully log in and access all dashboard features.

test_cases.Title: Verify Data Archiving Functionality

Steps.Step Description: Access the data archiving module as an authorized user.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and data archiving module is accessible.

Steps.Step Description: Initiate the data archiving process for a specified data set.
Steps.Expected Result: System starts the archiving process.

Steps.Step Description: Monitor the process until completion.
Steps.Expected Result: Data is archived without errors.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the archived data is retrievable and intact.
Steps.Expected Result: Archived data can be retrieved and matches the original data set.

test_cases.Preconditions: User has valid credentials and access rights. Data set to be archived is available.
test_cases.Dataset: Sample data set for archiving.
test_cases.Expected Result: Data is archived successfully and can be retrieved without loss or corruption.

test_cases.Title: Verify Dashboard Login Failure with Invalid Credentials

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the dashboard login page.
Steps.Expected Result: Login page is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Enter invalid credentials (e.g., incorrect password).
Steps.Expected Result: System rejects credentials and displays an error message.

test_cases.Preconditions: User account exists.
test_cases.Dataset: Invalid user credentials.
test_cases.Expected Result: Login attempt fails and an appropriate error message is shown.

test_cases.Title: Verify Data Collection Failure When Source Unavailable (SAP)

Steps.Step Description: Access the data collection module as an authorized user.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and data collection module is accessible.

Steps.Step Description: Simulate SAP source system being unavailable (e.g., disconnect network or stop SAP service).
Steps.Expected Result: SAP source is unreachable.

Steps.Step Description: Initiate data collection from SAP.
Steps.Expected Result: System fails to collect data and displays/logs an appropriate error message.

test_cases.Preconditions: User has valid credentials. SAP source system is intentionally made unavailable.
test_cases.Dataset: N/A (SAP source offline).
test_cases.Expected Result: System handles SAP source unavailability gracefully and provides a clear error message.

test_cases.Title: Verify Data Archiving for POS Out-of-Network

Steps.Step Description: Access the POS data archiving module as an authorized user.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and POS data archiving module is accessible.

Steps.Step Description: Select POS devices that are currently out of network.
Steps.Expected Result: System lists available out-of-network POS devices.

Steps.Step Description: Initiate the archiving process for selected POS devices.
Steps.Expected Result: System starts the archiving process for out-of-network POS data.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the data is archived and can be retrieved when the POS device reconnects.
Steps.Expected Result: Archived data is available and intact upon POS reconnection.

test_cases.Preconditions: User has valid credentials. At least one POS device is out of network and has data to archive.
test_cases.Dataset: POS device(s) out of network with sample data.
test_cases.Expected Result: Data from out-of-network POS devices is archived and retrievable upon reconnection.

test_cases.Title: Verify retrieval of unmodified store master data from MDM system

Steps.Step Description: Access the data collection module (FASE 1) as a user with appropriate permissions.
Steps.Expected Result: The data collection interface is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Select a store whose master data does not require modification (as per the latest 'ZENIT - Elenco dati' file).
Steps.Expected Result: The system identifies the store as not requiring data modification.

Steps.Step Description: Initiate the data retrieval process for the selected store.
Steps.Expected Result: The system fetches the store's master data from the MDM system.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the retrieved data matches the records in the MDM system for the selected store.
Steps.Expected Result: All master data fields are consistent with the MDM source and no modification prompts are shown.

test_cases.Preconditions: User has access to the data collection module. The MDM system is available and contains up-to-date master data for stores. The 'ZENIT - Elenco dati' file is available and up to date.
test_cases.Functionality: Data retrieval from MDM for unmodified store records
test_cases.Dataset: Store IDs with unmodified master data as per 'ZENIT - Elenco dati' and corresponding MDM records.
test_cases.Expected Result: The system retrieves and displays unmodified store master data from the MDM system, matching the source records exactly.

test_cases.Title: Verify system behavior when MDM is unavailable during data retrieval

Steps.Step Description: Simulate MDM system unavailability (e.g., disconnect network or stop MDM service).
Steps.Expected Result: MDM system is unreachable from the data collection module.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to retrieve master data for a store that does not require modification.
Steps.Expected Result: The system attempts to connect to MDM and fails.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the error message or system response.
Steps.Expected Result: A clear, user-friendly error message is displayed indicating that the MDM system is unavailable and data cannot be retrieved at this time.

test_cases.Preconditions: User has access to the data collection module. The MDM system is intentionally made unavailable. The 'ZENIT - Elenco dati' file is available.
test_cases.Dataset: Store IDs with unmodified master data as per 'ZENIT - Elenco dati'.
test_cases.Expected Result: The system gracefully handles MDM unavailability and informs the user appropriately without crashing or displaying technical errors.

test_cases.Title: Verify that only required data fields are retrieved as per 'ZENIT - Elenco dati' frequency

Steps.Step Description: Access the data collection module (FASE 1).
Steps.Expected Result: The data collection interface is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Select a store whose master data does not require modification.
Steps.Expected Result: The system identifies the store as not requiring data modification.

Steps.Step Description: Initiate the data retrieval process for the selected store.
Steps.Expected Result: The system fetches the store's master data from the MDM system.

Steps.Step Description: Compare the retrieved data fields with the list and frequency specified in the latest 'ZENIT - Elenco dati' file.
Steps.Expected Result: Only the required fields, as per the specified frequency, are retrieved and displayed.

test_cases.Preconditions: User has access to the data collection module. The MDM system is available. The latest 'ZENIT - Elenco dati' file is available and specifies field frequencies.
test_cases.Dataset: Store IDs and expected field list as per 'ZENIT - Elenco dati'.
test_cases.Expected Result: The system retrieves and displays only the required data fields for each store, in compliance with the 'ZENIT - Elenco dati' frequency specification.

test_cases.Title: Verify system does not allow modification of master data for stores marked as 'no modification required'

Steps.Step Description: Access the data collection module (FASE 1).
Steps.Expected Result: The data collection interface is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Select a store whose master data does not require modification.
Steps.Expected Result: The system identifies the store as not requiring data modification.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to edit any of the master data fields for the selected store.
Steps.Expected Result: The system prevents editing and displays a message indicating that modification is not allowed for this store.

test_cases.Preconditions: User has access to the data collection module. The MDM system is available. The 'ZENIT - Elenco dati' file is available and up to date.
test_cases.Functionality: Edit restriction for unmodifiable store data
test_cases.Dataset: Store IDs marked as 'no modification required' in 'ZENIT - Elenco dati'.
test_cases.Expected Result: The system does not allow modification of master data for stores marked as 'no modification required'.

test_cases.Title: Verify transmission of Insoluti flow data on PoS overdue change

Steps.Step Description: Trigger a variation in the overdue (insoluti) status for a specific PoS in SAP.
Steps.Expected Result: System detects the change in overdue status for the PoS.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the following data is retrieved from SAP for the affected PoS: IdRice, Numero Insoluti Totali, Numero Insoluti Anno Corrente, Numero Insoluti a 6 mesi Rolling, Numero Insoluti a 12 mesi Rolling.
Steps.Expected Result: All required data fields are correctly retrieved from SAP.

Steps.Step Description: Check that the system sends the retrieved data as a flow to the designated recipient/system.
Steps.Expected Result: Data flow is sent containing all required fields with correct values.

test_cases.Preconditions: PoS exists in SAP with at least one overdue record. System is connected to SAP and able to receive change notifications.
test_cases.Functionality: Insoluti flow data extraction and transmission
test_cases.Dataset: PoS with overdue records and known values for all required fields.
test_cases.Expected Result: Upon any change in PoS overdue status, the system retrieves and sends all required Insoluti data fields from SAP.

test_cases.Title: Verify Garanzie flow data transmission on PoS guarantee change

Steps.Step Description: Trigger a variation in the guarantee (garanzia) status for a specific PoS in SAP (e.g., add or modify a guarantee).
Steps.Expected Result: System detects the change in guarantee status for the PoS.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the following data is retrieved from SAP: IdRice, Tipologia Garanzia, Importo Saldo Complessivo per tipologia Garanzie, Data Inizio Garanzia (if Fidejussioni), Data Scadenza Garanzia (if Fidejussioni).
Steps.Expected Result: All required data fields are correctly retrieved from SAP, with date fields present only for Fidejussioni.

Steps.Step Description: Check that the system sends the retrieved data as a flow to the designated recipient/system.
Steps.Expected Result: Data flow is sent containing all required fields with correct values.

test_cases.Preconditions: PoS exists in SAP with at least one guarantee record. System is connected to SAP and able to receive change notifications.
test_cases.Functionality: Garanzie flow data extraction and transmission
test_cases.Dataset: PoS with different types of guarantees, including Fidejussioni with known start and end dates.
test_cases.Expected Result: Upon any change in PoS guarantee status, the system retrieves and sends all required Garanzie data fields from SAP.

test_cases.Title: Verify Blocco al Sollecito flow data transmission on status change

Steps.Step Description: Trigger a variation in the 'Blocco al Sollecito' status for a specific PoS in SAP (e.g., escalate from 'piano di rientro' to 'diffida').
Steps.Expected Result: System detects the change in Blocco al Sollecito status for the PoS.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the following data is retrieved from SAP: IdRice, Blocco al Sollecito (only the most severe block for the customer, regardless of company).
Steps.Expected Result: System retrieves only the most severe block according to the defined hierarchy.

Steps.Step Description: Check that the system sends the retrieved data as a flow to the designated recipient/system.
Steps.Expected Result: Data flow is sent containing IdRice and the most severe Blocco al Sollecito value.

test_cases.Preconditions: PoS exists in SAP with at least one open item and a Blocco al Sollecito status. System is connected to SAP and able to receive change notifications.
test_cases.Functionality: Blocco al Sollecito flow data extraction and transmission
test_cases.Dataset: PoS with multiple block statuses to test hierarchy (e.g., legal > diffida > piano di rientro).
test_cases.Expected Result: Upon any change in Blocco al Sollecito status, the system retrieves and sends only the most severe block for the customer from SAP.

test_cases.Title: Verify successful creation of credit flow between ZENIT and MST for horse racing bets

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the ZENIT system as an authorized user.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in and has access to horse racing betting functionalities.

Steps.Step Description: Initiate a horse racing bet that requires credit management.
Steps.Expected Result: The system prompts for credit validation and initiates a request to MST.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that ZENIT sends the credit management request to MST using the new flow.
Steps.Expected Result: A correctly formatted request is sent from ZENIT to MST.

Steps.Step Description: Check MST receives and processes the credit management request.
Steps.Expected Result: MST receives the request and processes it according to business rules.

Steps.Step Description: Confirm that MST sends a response back to ZENIT with the credit decision.
Steps.Expected Result: MST sends a valid response (approval or rejection) to ZENIT.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that ZENIT updates the bet status based on MST's response.
Steps.Expected Result: ZENIT updates the bet status (approved/rejected) and displays the correct information to the user.

test_cases.Preconditions: ZENIT and MST systems are operational and integrated. Test user has sufficient permissions. Horse racing betting is enabled.
test_cases.Functionality: Credit management flow for horse racing bets between ZENIT and MST
test_cases.Dataset: Test user credentials, horse racing event data, credit limits.
test_cases.Expected Result: The credit management flow between ZENIT and MST is executed successfully, and the bet is processed according to the credit decision.

test_cases.Title: Verify error handling when MST is unavailable during credit flow

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the ZENIT system as an authorized user.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in.

Steps.Step Description: Initiate a horse racing bet that requires credit management.
Steps.Expected Result: ZENIT attempts to send a credit management request to MST.

Steps.Step Description: Simulate MST being unavailable (e.g., network failure or MST service down).
Steps.Expected Result: ZENIT does not receive a response from MST within the expected timeframe.

Steps.Step Description: Observe how ZENIT handles the lack of response from MST.
Steps.Expected Result: ZENIT displays an appropriate error message to the user and does not process the bet.

test_cases.Preconditions: ZENIT and MST systems are integrated. MST is intentionally made unavailable for this test. Test user has permissions.
test_cases.Functionality: Error handling in credit management flow
test_cases.Dataset: Test user credentials, horse racing event data.
test_cases.Expected Result: ZENIT gracefully handles MST unavailability by informing the user and preventing bet processing.

test_cases.Title: Verify credit flow for horse racing bets with insufficient credit

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the ZENIT system as an authorized user with limited credit.
Steps.Expected Result: User is logged in and has access to horse racing betting.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to place a horse racing bet that exceeds the user's available credit.
Steps.Expected Result: ZENIT sends a credit management request to MST.

Steps.Step Description: MST evaluates the request and determines that the credit is insufficient.
Steps.Expected Result: MST sends a rejection response to ZENIT.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that ZENIT displays an appropriate message to the user and does not process the bet.
Steps.Expected Result: User is informed of insufficient credit and the bet is not placed.

test_cases.Preconditions: ZENIT and MST systems are operational and integrated. Test user has limited credit.
test_cases.Functionality: Credit validation for horse racing bets
test_cases.Dataset: Test user credentials with limited credit, horse racing event data.
test_cases.Expected Result: Bets exceeding available credit are rejected and the user is informed accordingly.

test_cases.Title: Verify credit flow for horse racing bets with sufficient credit

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the ZENIT system as an authorized user with sufficient credit.
Steps.Expected Result: User is logged in and has access to horse racing betting.

Steps.Step Description: Place a horse racing bet within the user's available credit limit.
Steps.Expected Result: ZENIT sends a credit management request to MST.

Steps.Step Description: MST evaluates the request and approves the credit.
Steps.Expected Result: MST sends an approval response to ZENIT.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that ZENIT processes the bet and updates the user's credit accordingly.
Steps.Expected Result: Bet is placed successfully and the user's credit is updated.

test_cases.Preconditions: ZENIT and MST systems are operational and integrated. Test user has sufficient credit.
test_cases.Functionality: Credit validation for horse racing bets
test_cases.Dataset: Test user credentials with sufficient credit, horse racing event data.
test_cases.Expected Result: Bets within available credit are approved and processed successfully.

test_cases.Title: Verify audit logging for credit flow transactions between ZENIT and MST

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the ZENIT system as an authorized user.

test_cases.Expected Result: All credit flow transactions are properly logged for traceability and compliance.
