Steps.Step Description: Attempt to click the 'Export to Excel' button.
Steps.Expected Result: System displays an appropriate message indicating that there is no data to export, and no file is generated.

test_cases.Preconditions: User has valid credentials; PoS reports dataset is empty or filtered to return no results.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user credentials; PoS reports dataset empty.
test_cases.Expected Result: System prevents export and informs the user when no data is available for export.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers error scenario for export functionality.

test_cases.Title: Verify Access to Data History Section

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the application with valid user credentials.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in and navigated to the main dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Storico Dati' (Data History) section from the main menu or dashboard.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Storico Dati' section is displayed to the user.

test_cases.Preconditions: User account exists and is active. User has access rights to view data history.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user credentials with data history available.
test_cases.Expected Result: User is able to access the 'Storico Dati' section without errors.

test_cases.Title: Verify Display of Data History Records

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the application with a user account that has historical data.
Steps.Expected Result: User is logged in and main dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Storico Dati' section.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Storico Dati' section is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the list of historical data records displayed.
Steps.Expected Result: All available historical data records for the user are displayed in a list or table format.

test_cases.Preconditions: User account with historical data exists.
test_cases.Dataset: User account with at least one historical data record.
test_cases.Expected Result: Historical data records are correctly displayed to the user.

test_cases.Title: Verify Data History Section When No Records Exist

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the application with a user account that has no historical data.
Steps.Expected Result: User is logged in and main dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Storico Dati' section.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Storico Dati' section is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the message or display when no historical data is present.
Steps.Expected Result: A clear message is shown indicating that no historical data is available for the user.

test_cases.Preconditions: User account with no historical data exists.
test_cases.Dataset: User account with no historical data records.
test_cases.Expected Result: User is informed that no historical data is available.

test_cases.Title: Verify Data History Pagination and Navigation

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the application with a user account that has more historical data records than can be displayed on a single page (e.g., more than 20 records).
Steps.Expected Result: User is logged in and main dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Storico Dati' section.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Storico Dati' section is displayed with the first page of records.

Steps.Step Description: Use the pagination controls to navigate to the next page of records.
Steps.Expected Result: The next set of historical data records is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate back to the previous page using the pagination controls.
Steps.Expected Result: The previous set of historical data records is displayed.

test_cases.Preconditions: User account with more than one page of historical data records exists.
test_cases.Dataset: User account with more than 20 historical data records.
test_cases.Expected Result: User can navigate through multiple pages of historical data records without errors.

test_cases.Title: Verify Data History Filtering by Date Range

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the application with a user account that has historical data spanning multiple dates.
Steps.Expected Result: User is logged in and main dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Storico Dati' section.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Storico Dati' section is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Select a specific date range using the filter controls.
Steps.Expected Result: Date range filter is applied.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the displayed historical data records.
Steps.Expected Result: Only records within the selected date range are displayed.

test_cases.Preconditions: User account with historical data across multiple dates exists.
test_cases.Dataset: User account with historical data from different dates.
test_cases.Expected Result: Historical data records are filtered correctly according to the selected date range.

test_cases.Title: Verify Unauthorized Access to Data History Section

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the application with a user account that does not have permission to access the 'Storico Dati' section.
Steps.Expected Result: User is logged in and main dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to navigate to the 'Storico Dati' section.
Steps.Expected Result: Access is denied and an appropriate error message is displayed.

test_cases.Preconditions: User account without permission to access data history exists.
test_cases.Dataset: User account without access rights to data history.
test_cases.Expected Result: User is prevented from accessing the 'Storico Dati' section and receives a clear error message.

test_cases.Title: Verify Daily Data Snapshot Archiving at 00:00

Steps.Step Description: Ensure the system clock is set to 23:59 on a day with active data transactions.
Steps.Expected Result: System is ready to transition to the next day.

Steps.Step Description: Wait until the system time reaches 00:00.
Steps.Expected Result: System triggers the daily snapshot process.

Steps.Step Description: Check the archive for a new snapshot corresponding to the previous day.
Steps.Expected Result: A new data snapshot for the previous day is present in the archive.

Steps.Step Description: Compare the archived snapshot with the data present at 23:59 of the previous day.
Steps.Expected Result: Archived snapshot accurately reflects the data state as of 23:59 of the previous day.

test_cases.Preconditions: System is live and operational. Data transactions have occurred during the day. Archiving schedule is configured as per requirements.
test_cases.Dataset: Test data for PoS and transactions present in the system for the day.
test_cases.Expected Result: System creates and stores a daily snapshot of all required data at 00:00, accurately reflecting the previous day's state.

test_cases.Title: Verify Data Retention and Deletion for PoS Without Pending Issues After Contract Termination

Steps.Step Description: Identify a PoS with no pending issues or disputes and an expired contract.
Steps.Expected Result: PoS with expired contract and no pending issues is identified.

Steps.Step Description: Trigger the data deletion process for the identified PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: System initiates the deletion process for the PoS data.

Steps.Step Description: Check the archive for the presence of the PoS data after deletion.
Steps.Expected Result: PoS data is no longer present in the archive.

test_cases.Preconditions: PoS exists in the system with no pending issues or disputes. Contract for PoS has expired. Data archiving is operational.
test_cases.Dataset: PoS record with expired contract and no pending issues.
test_cases.Expected Result: System deletes data for PoS with expired contracts and no pending issues, ensuring data is no longer accessible.

test_cases.Title: Verify Data Retention for PoS With Pending Issues After Contract Termination

Steps.Step Description: Identify a PoS with pending issues or disputes and an expired contract.
Steps.Expected Result: PoS with expired contract and pending issues is identified.

Steps.Step Description: Trigger the data deletion process for the identified PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: System evaluates the retention policy for PoS with pending issues.

Steps.Step Description: Check the archive for the presence of the PoS data after attempted deletion.
Steps.Expected Result: PoS data is retained in the archive as per the 10-year retention policy.

test_cases.Preconditions: PoS exists in the system with pending issues or disputes. Contract for PoS has expired. Data archiving is operational.
test_cases.Functionality: Data retention for PoS with pending issues
test_cases.Dataset: PoS record with expired contract and pending issues.
test_cases.Expected Result: System retains data for PoS with pending issues for 10 years from the last accounting movement, as required.

test_cases.Title: Verify Data Accessibility for Future Queries on Archived Data

Steps.Step Description: Archive data for multiple PoS and products over several days.
Steps.Expected Result: Archived data is available for multiple PoS and products.

Steps.Step Description: Perform a query to retrieve data for a specific PoS and product on a particular day of the week.
Steps.Expected Result: System returns the correct archived data for the specified PoS, product, and day.

Steps.Step Description: Perform a query to retrieve the number of unpaid items (insoluti) for a PoS on a specific day.
Steps.Expected Result: System returns the correct count of unpaid items for the specified PoS and day.

test_cases.Preconditions: Archived data exists for multiple PoS and products over several days. Query interface is available.
test_cases.Dataset: Archived data for multiple PoS, products, and days; query parameters for PoS, product, and date.
test_cases.Expected Result: System allows querying of archived data by PoS, product, and date, returning accurate results for each query.

test_cases.Title: Verify Data Archiving Frequency as Defined in 'ZENIT - elenco dati' Excel File

Steps.Step Description: Open the 'ZENIT - elenco dati' Excel file and identify data fields and their required archiving frequency.
Steps.Expected Result: List of data fields and their archiving frequencies is available.

Steps.Step Description: Monitor the archiving process for each data field over a defined period.
Steps.Expected Result: Archiving process is executed as per the defined frequency for each data field.

Steps.Step Description: Compare the archived data with the expected frequency from the Excel file.
Steps.Expected Result: Archived data matches the frequency specified in the Excel file for each field.

test_cases.Preconditions: 'ZENIT - elenco dati' Excel file is available and up to date. Data archiving process is operational.
test_cases.Dataset: 'ZENIT - elenco dati' Excel file; system data for archiving.
test_cases.Expected Result: System archives each data field at the frequency specified in the 'ZENIT - elenco dati' Excel file.

test_cases.Title: Verify Data Visibility Restrictions for Archived Data Based on User Profile

Steps.Step Description: Identify archived data for PoS with pending issues and expired contracts.
Steps.Expected Result: Archived data for PoS with pending issues is available.

Steps.Step Description: Log in as a user with restricted profile access.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated with restricted profile.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to access archived data for the identified PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: System restricts access to certain data fields as per profile permissions.

Steps.Step Description: Log in as a user with full access profile.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated with full access profile.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to access the same archived data for the identified PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: System allows access to all permitted data fields for the full access profile.

test_cases.Preconditions: Archived data for PoS with pending issues exists. User profiles with different access levels are configured.
test_cases.Dataset: Archived data for PoS with pending issues; user accounts with different profiles.
test_cases.Expected Result: System restricts or allows access to archived data based on user profile permissions as defined.

test_cases.Title: Importazione manuale file PoS fuori rete con dati completi e validi

Steps.Step Description: Preparare un file di importazione con tutti i campi richiesti (ID RICE, ZONA RICE, DENOMINAZIONE, RAGIONE SOCIALE, INDIRIZZO, COMUNE, P.IVA, COD. FISCALE, IMPORTO CREDITO, STATUS, PASSAGGIO A PERDITA) valorizzati con dati validi per almeno un record.
Steps.Expected Result: Il file  pronto per l'importazione e rispetta il formato richiesto.

Steps.Step Description: Accedere al sistema Zenit come utente autorizzato all'importazione dati.
Steps.Expected Result: Accesso al sistema Zenit effettuato con successo.

Steps.Step Description: Navigare alla funzionalit di importazione dati PoS fuori rete.
Steps.Expected Result: La schermata di importazione  visualizzata.

Steps.Step Description: Caricare il file preparato e avviare l'importazione.
Steps.Expected Result: Il sistema accetta il file e avvia il processo di importazione.

Steps.Step Description: Verificare che il sistema confermi l'importazione avvenuta senza errori.
Steps.Expected Result: Messaggio di conferma importazione completata con successo.

Steps.Step Description: Verificare che i dati importati siano correttamente visualizzati e corrispondano a quelli presenti nel file.
Steps.Expected Result: Tutti i dati dei PoS importati sono corretti e completi nel sistema Zenit.

test_cases.Reference System: Zenit - Importazione dati PoS fuori rete
test_cases.Preconditions: Utente con permessi di importazione; file di importazione conforme e disponibile.
test_cases.Functionality: Importazione dati PoS fuori rete da file manuale
test_cases.Dataset: File CSV/XLSX con dati validi per tutti i campi richiesti.
test_cases.Expected Result: Il sistema importa correttamente tutti i dati dei PoS fuori rete dal file manuale senza errori.

test_cases.Title: Gestione errore importazione file PoS con campi obbligatori mancanti

Steps.Step Description: Preparare un file di importazione con almeno un record in cui uno o pi campi obbligatori (es. ID RICE, IMPORTO CREDITO) sono vuoti o mancanti.
Steps.Expected Result: Il file contiene dati incompleti.

Steps.Step Description: Accedere al sistema Zenit come utente autorizzato.
Steps.Expected Result: Accesso effettuato con successo.

Steps.Step Description: Navigare alla funzionalit di importazione dati PoS fuori rete.
Steps.Expected Result: La schermata di importazione  visualizzata.

Steps.Step Description: Caricare il file preparato e avviare l'importazione.
Steps.Expected Result: Il sistema rileva la presenza di campi obbligatori mancanti.

Steps.Step Description: Verificare che il sistema blocchi l'importazione e mostri un messaggio di errore dettagliato.
Steps.Expected Result: Messaggio di errore che indica i campi mancanti e nessun dato viene importato.

test_cases.Reference System: Zenit - Importazione dati PoS fuori rete
test_cases.Preconditions: Utente con permessi di importazione; file di importazione con campi obbligatori mancanti.
test_cases.Functionality: Validazione campi obbligatori in importazione dati PoS
test_cases.Dataset: File CSV/XLSX con almeno un campo obbligatorio mancante.
test_cases.Expected Result: Il sistema blocca l'importazione e segnala chiaramente i campi mancanti.

test_cases.Title: Modifica dati PoS importati dopo caricamento manuale

Steps.Step Description: Importare un file valido di PoS fuori rete seguendo la procedura standard.
Steps.Expected Result: I dati vengono importati correttamente.

Steps.Step Description: Accedere alla sezione di gestione/modifica dei dati PoS importati.
Steps.Expected Result: La lista dei PoS importati  visualizzata.

Steps.Step Description: Selezionare un record e modificare uno o pi campi (es. STATUS, IMPORTO CREDITO).
Steps.Expected Result: I campi selezionati sono editabili.

Steps.Step Description: Salvare le modifiche effettuate.
Steps.Expected Result: Il sistema conferma il salvataggio delle modifiche.

Steps.Step Description: Verificare che le modifiche siano correttamente salvate e visualizzate.
Steps.Expected Result: I dati aggiornati sono correttamente visualizzati nel sistema Zenit.

test_cases.Reference System: Zenit - Gestione dati PoS fuori rete
test_cases.Preconditions: Almeno un record PoS fuori rete importato correttamente.
test_cases.Functionality: Modifica dati PoS fuori rete importati
test_cases.Dataset: Record PoS importato da file manuale.
test_cases.Expected Result: Le modifiche ai dati PoS importati sono salvate e visualizzate correttamente.

test_cases.Title: Importazione file PoS con valori non validi nei campi numerici o booleani

Steps.Step Description: Preparare un file di importazione con almeno un record in cui il campo IMPORTO CREDITO contiene un valore non numerico e/o il campo PASSAGGIO A PERDITA contiene un valore diverso da 'si' o 'no'.
Steps.Expected Result: Il file contiene valori non validi nei campi specificati.

Steps.Step Description: Accedere al sistema Zenit come utente autorizzato.
Steps.Expected Result: Accesso effettuato con successo.

Steps.Step Description: Navigare alla funzionalit di importazione dati PoS fuori rete.
Steps.Expected Result: La schermata di importazione  visualizzata.

Steps.Step Description: Caricare il file preparato e avviare l'importazione.
Steps.Expected Result: Il sistema rileva i valori non validi nei campi numerici o booleani.

Steps.Step Description: Verificare che il sistema blocchi l'importazione e mostri un messaggio di errore specifico.
Steps.Expected Result: Messaggio di errore che indica i valori non validi e nessun dato viene importato.

test_cases.Reference System: Zenit - Importazione dati PoS fuori rete
test_cases.Preconditions: Utente con permessi di importazione; file di importazione con valori non validi nei campi numerici/booleani.
test_cases.Functionality: Validazione valori campi numerici/booleani in importazione dati PoS
test_cases.Dataset: File CSV/XLSX con valori non numerici in IMPORTO CREDITO e/o valori diversi da 'si/no' in PASSAGGIO A PERDITA.
test_cases.Expected Result: Il sistema blocca l'importazione e segnala chiaramente i valori non validi nei campi.

test_cases.Title: Importazione file PoS con record duplicati (stesso ID RICE)

Steps.Step Description: Preparare un file di importazione con almeno due record aventi lo stesso valore di ID RICE.
Steps.Expected Result: Il file contiene record duplicati per ID RICE.

Steps.Step Description: Accedere al sistema Zenit come utente autorizzato.
Steps.Expected Result: Accesso effettuato con successo.

Steps.Step Description: Navigare alla funzionalit di importazione dati PoS fuori rete.
Steps.Expected Result: La schermata di importazione  visualizzata.

Steps.Step Description: Caricare il file preparato e avviare l'importazione.
Steps.Expected Result: Il sistema rileva la presenza di record duplicati.

Steps.Step Description: Verificare che il sistema blocchi l'importazione o gestisca i duplicati secondo le specifiche (es. importazione solo del primo record, segnalazione di errore, ecc.).
Steps.Expected Result: Il sistema segnala la presenza di duplicati e si comporta secondo le specifiche (blocco o importazione parziale).

test_cases.Reference System: Zenit - Importazione dati PoS fuori rete
test_cases.Preconditions: Utente con permessi di importazione; file di importazione con record duplicati.
test_cases.Functionality: Gestione duplicati in importazione dati PoS
test_cases.Dataset: File CSV/XLSX con almeno due record con stesso ID RICE.
test_cases.Expected Result: Il sistema segnala e gestisce correttamente i record duplicati in fase di importazione.
